alert.note: Alert for North Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 3:25PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Big Horn and east central Park Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 324 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Garland, or 7 miles southeast of Powell, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Byron. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton.
